definition: to band together/to gang up/to stick together
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The team must hang together in spite of their many losses.
sentences.chinese: 尽管失败多次，这个队一定要同心协力，抱成一团。

sentences.english: They were a clannish lot, not given to welcoming strangers.
sentences.chinese: 他们那帮人抱成一团，不怎么欢迎生人。

sentences.english: As we shiver to hold together until the day dawn soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们就那样哆嗦地抱成一团，直到天快破晓。

sentences.english: We stayed huddled that way until the early hours of the morning.
sentences.chinese: 我们就那样哆嗦地抱成一团，直到天快破晓。

sentences.english: As we hugged, I felt we were closing the loop.
sentences.chinese: 在我们拥抱的时候，我简直觉得我俩抱成一团。

definition: to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to work as one (idiom); united in a concerted effort/working hard together
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
